channel.title: Different languanges effectiness in rsps's
channel.description: would PHP or HTML5 be more effective and efficient for a rsps or would java be the best languange to use? just wondering ...and how easy would it be to convert it? and ive looked up some stuff on PHP it looked pretty easy but idk how effective itd be for a rsps

item.title: Different languanges effectiness in rsps's
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:17, topic:535899”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=654709.msg4385081#msg4385081 date=1385077860]

[quote author=hadesflames link=topic=654709.msg4385060#msg4385060 date=1385066455]

If you’re just talking about the backend then you can do everything over HTTP using PHP and you’d need a custom client that communicates with HTTP instead of sockets.

PHP has sockets.

http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.sockets.php
[/quote]so does html5.

i dont see why this couldn’t be done with any language that currently exists, given majority of languages have i/o libraries, or third party libraries available.

of course, you’re going to want to be highly proficient in the language before attempting the task, then get highly familiar with the protocol itself.
[/quote]yeah but good luck running a server using htm5 :P[/quote]why would anyone need luck doing this?

Read full topic

item.title: Different languanges effectiness in rsps's
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:15, topic:535899”][quote author=hadesflames link=topic=654709.msg4385072#msg4385072 date=1385071219]

it’ll be just as easy to do this in PHP (compared to java)

That’s not true.
[/quote]personally i believe it would be roughly the same level of difficulty, as someone who has programmed a lot of stuff in both java and php over the past 10 years. the language is different, but its syntax and constructs are fairly similar and the only major differences are the library functions. obviously if you don’t know php well, then yeah it’s gonna be a pain.[/quote]

It has nothing to do with how well you know php, and everything to do with how much of a piece of shit php is. Not to mention, it’s still just a scripting language.

Read full topic

item.title: Different languanges effectiness in rsps's
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

xx matty xx:

If you’re just talking about the backend then you can do everything over HTTP using PHP and you’d need a custom client that communicates with HTTP instead of sockets.

PHP has sockets.

http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.sockets.php

Read full topic

item.title: Different languanges effectiness in rsps's
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

You’re not really being very specific about what you’re actually implementing in these languages. If you’re just talking about the backend then you can do everything over HTTP using PHP and you’d need a custom client that communicates with HTTP instead of sockets. It wouldn’t be great because HTTP is stateless and it’s only a request-response thing, so you’d be making a lot of requests and causing a lot of network and cpu overhead. One advantage I guess is that you don’t need to hold sockets open so maybe the server would use less memory.

As for the client, yes I see no reason why you can’t implement it with HTML/JS using WebGL. You might have a few problems working out how to make network connections because of sandboxing etc, but it should be possible provided that everything’s on the same domain name.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:535899”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=654709.msg4384995#msg4384995 date=1385033150]

Yeah, good luck converting this to php. and there’d be no way in hell this could be done with pure html5. You’d need another more powerful language to do the work.

I think someone has written a server in PHP before.
[/quote]
I didn’t say it was not possible. I said good luck.
And I believe that was Vain_ that wrote a gameframe in php and had then inventory working or something related[/quote]
I didn’t say that you didn’t say it wasn’t possible, I stated that it has already been done which will significantly lower the workload needed for holylouis to write it in PHP (as some of the work is already there to be referenced from). Vain_ wasn’t working on a RuneScape emulation, his was more of a PHP client.

Read full topic
